repnme.cdata!:
Niger - First Adaptable Program Lending
            Basin Water Resources Development and Sustainable Ecosystems
            Management Project : INT redacted report

abstracts.cdata!:
The Niger First Adaptable Program
            Lending Basin Water Resources Development and Sustainable
            Ecosystems Management Project aimed to enhance regional
            coordination among the member countries of the Niger basin,
            and to promote the development and management of the water
            resources of the Niger River basin. This report provides the
            findings of an administrative inquiry by the World Bank
            Group (WBG) Integrity Vice Presidency (INT) into allegations
            that Company A may have engaged in misconduct in connection
            with the Niger basin water resources development and
            sustainable ecosystems management project APL 1 and the
            Niger Second Emergency Food Security Support Project.
            Company A submitted bids for several contracts under the
            projects. Company A’s bids included several bid securities;
            all purportedly issued by Bank A. Evidence indicates that
            the bid securities submitted by Company A were not
            authentic. Evidence also indicates that Company A made
            misrepresentations regarding its prior experience in its
            bids for several contracts under the projects. The WB
            imposed a sanction of debarment with conditional release on
            Company A, which extends to any legal entity that is
            directly or indirectly controlled by Company A.
